title: Channel: EGI Repository - Production level  releases
description: This is the EGI Repository Releases  RSS channel.

item.description: CMD-ONE 1.1.0 (CMD for OpenNebula) is an update of the Cloud Middleware Distribution targeted for use with OpenNebula 5 on CentOS7.
CMD-ONE 1.0.0 (CMD for OpenNebula) is the first major release of the Cloud Middleware Distribution, targeted for use with OpenNebula 5. It contains packages for CentOS7 only.
test description
CMD-OS 1.3.0 (CMD for OpenStack) is an update of the Cloud Middleware Distribution targeted for use with OpenStack. It includes updates for CentOS7 and Ubuntu.
CMD-OS 1.2.1 (CMD for OpenStack) is an fix release of the Cloud Middleware Distribution. It includes a fix for cloudkeeper-os for CentOS7, and a new release of cASO for CentOS7 and Ubuntu.
CMD-OS 1.2.0 (CMD for OpenStack) is a minor update of the Cloud Middleware Distribution. This release includes updates for use with OpenStack Mitaka and above, on CentOS7 and Ubuntu 16 (Xenial).
CMD-OS 1.1.3 (CMD for OpenStack) is a revision of the Cloud Middleware Distribution, targeted for use with OpenStack Mitaka.It contains updates for CentOS7 and Ubuntu Xenial.
CMD-OS 1.1.2 (CMD for OpenStack) is a revision of the Cloud Middleware Distribution, targeted for use with OpenStack Mitaka. It adds the python-daemon package.
CMD-OS 1.1.1 (CMD for OpenStack) is a revision of the Cloud Middleware Distribution, targeted for use with OpenStack Mitaka. It contains a fix for the cmd-release package.

CMD-OS 1.1.0 (CMD for OpenStack) is a minor update of the Cloud Middleware Distribution, targeted for use with OpenStack Mitaka. It contains packages for Ubuntu Xenial (Ubuntu 16) and CentOS7. Ubuntu Xenial packages are supposed to be backward-compatible also with Ubuntu Trusty (Ubuntu 14).

CMD-OS 1.0.0 (CMD for OpenStack) is the first release of the Cloud Middleware Distribution, targeted for use with OpenStack Mitaka. It contains packages for Ubuntu Trusty (Ubuntu 14) and CentOS7. Ubuntu Trusty packages are compatible also with Ubuntu Xenial (Ubuntu 16), so the Ubuntu Trusty repository can be used under Xenial as well.
CMD-OS 0.0.0 is a test release of the first Major release of CMD for OpenStack. In particular, it contains new packages and updates both for Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.
UMD 5.0.0 is a test release of UMD 5. It includes the configuration package
UMD 4.18.0 is an revision update release of UMD 4.
UMD 4.17.2 is an revision update release of UMD 4.
UMD 4.17.1 is an revision update release of UMD 4. It includes the new Golden Dcache release 7.2.15, argus 1.7.5 and update of the topbdii glite-info-provider-ldap package 1.5.0.

UMD 4.17 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes Myproxy 6.2.14, gridFTP 13.26.1, xroot 5.4.3, condor 9.0.16, htcondor-CE 5.1.3, dCache 6.2.44, gfal2 clients and  new nagios probes for ondedata and IM.
revision contaning update for the CVMFS EGI default configurations.
UMD 4.16.1 revision contaning updates for the CVMFS and default configurations.
UMD 4.16 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes ARC-CE 6.14.0, Xrootd 5.3.4 and new nagios probes for qcg, check-ss-cert, srm and webdav

UMD 4.15.1 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes ARC-CE 6.13.0, Xrootd 5.3.1, CERN EOS 5.0.2, dCache 6.2.31, Infrastructure Manager Nagios probe 1.3.1, GridFTP 13.21.1, gfal2 2.19.2, gfal2-utils 1.6.0, EGI CVMFS 3.3.16, CVMFS 2.8.2, HTCondor 9.0.1 and HTCondor-CE 5.1.1.

UMD 4.15.0 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes StoRM 1.11.21, lcmaps-plugins 1.8.1, CERN Frontier 4.15.2, dmlite 1.15.0, APEL SSM 3.2.1, DDNS Nagios probe 1.0.1, dCache 6.2.24, Infrastructure Manager Nagios probe 1.0.1.
UMD 4.14.10 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes ARC 6.12.0, xrootd 5.2.0, xrootd 5.2.0, davix 0.7.6, gridftp 13.24.1, gfal2 2.18.2.
UMD 4.13.1 is a fix release of UMD 4. It includes a new releases for CERN Frontier.
UMD 4.13.0 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes new releases for ARC, APEL, StoRM, VOMS admin server, VOMS client, CVMFS.
UMD 4.12.6 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes new packages for ARGO AMS library and APEL SSM.
UMD 4.12.5 is a fix release of UMD 4. It includes fixes a problem with the dCache distribution in UMD.
UMD 4.12.4 is an emergency release of UMD 4. It includes fixes for StoRM and dCache.
UMD 4.12.3 is an upgrade of UMD 4. It includes StoRM, VOMS and BDII, in particular StoRM and VOMS have been included in CentOS7 for the first time.
UMD 4.12.2 is a fix release of UMD 4. It includes a fix for egi-cvmfs (a specific version is required by cvmfs) and a fix for ARC CE dependencies.
UMD 4.12.1 is a fix release of UMD 4. It includes a fix for nordugrid-arc-client.
UMD 4.12.0 is a regular release of UMD 4. It includes an update of CERN Frontier for CentOS7 and SL6.
The UMD 4.11.3 is an emergency release of the UMD 4 release. It includes an update of CERN Frontier for CentOS7 and SL6.
The UMD 4.11.2 is an emergency release of the UMD 4 release. It includes an update of dCache  for both CentOS7 and SL6.
The UMD 4.11.1 is an emergency release of the UMD 4 release. It includes an update of CERN Frontier for CentOS7 and SL6.
The UMD 4.11.0 is a regular release of the UMD 4 release. It includes several updates for CentOS7 and SL6.
The UMD 4.10.3 is a fix of the UMD 4 release. It includes a package that fixes HTCondor dependencies.
The UMD 4.10.2 is a fix release of UMD 4. It includes fixes for HTCondor and CERN Frontier.
The UMD 4.10.1 is a fix of the UMD 4 release. It includes a package that fixes xroot dependencies.
The UMD 4.10.0 is a regular release of UMD 4. It includes several products for CentOS7 and SL6, see the release notes for further details.
The UMD 4.9.2 is an emergency fix for UMD 4. It includes a fix for CERN Frontier.

The UMD 4.9.1 is an update release of UMD 4. It includes dCache 5.2.10 and CVMFS 2.6.3 for CentOS7 and SL6. It also contains HTCondor 8.8.1, HTCondor-CE 3.2.1for CentOS7.  WARNING: HTCondor and HTCondor-CE have been released in UMD 4.9.1 pointing to the original documentation and without providing EGI-specific installation and configuration guides.
The UMD 4.9.0 is a regular release of UMD 4. It includes updates for several products, for CentOS7 and SL6.
The UMD 4.8.5 is dedicated to release DPM 1.13.0, distributed to specifically support sites enabling DOME and disabling the legacy mode.
UMD 4.8.4 is a fix release of the fourth Major release of UMD. It includes a missing package needed for DPM.
UMD 4.8.3 is an update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It includes updates for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.8.2 is an update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It includes updates for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.8.1 is an emergency fix of the fourth Major release of UMD. It adds a fix for FTS-Monitoring in CentOS7 that updates dependencies from python-django to python-django16.
UMD 4.8.0 is a regular update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It add updates for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.7.2 is a fix release of the fourth Major release of UMD. It add the missing package bouncycastle1.58-pkix.

UMD 4.7.1 is an emergency fix release of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CREAM on CentOS7 and SL6, which got broken with updates to bouncycastle and canl-java in UMD 4.7.0. Please carefully read the CREAM release notes (https://cream-guide.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Releases.html) as there are some workarounds to be applied after installing CREAM on SL6.
UMD 4.7.0 is a regular update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.6.1 is a revision of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.6.0 is a minor update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.5.0 is a minor update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.4.2 is a revision update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updated packages for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.4.1 is an emergency update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains a bug fix for VOMS Admin server.
UMD 4.4.0 is an update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains several new products and updates for CentOS7 and SL6, plus security fix for canL.
UMD 4.3.2 is a revision update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains a fix for umd-release for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.3.1 is a revision update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains products for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.3.0 is a regular update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains new products for CentOS7 and updates both for SL6 and CentOS7.
UMD 4.2.1 is a revision update of the fourth Major release of UMD. It contains updates both for SL6 and CentOS7.
UMD 4.2.0 is a revision update of the fourth Major release of UMD. In particular, it contains new packages and updates both for SL6 and CentOS7.

UMD 4.1.1 is a revision update of the fourth Major release of UMD. In particular, this release a package (edg-mkgridmap) that was missing in the first release of UMD4 with SL6 (4.1.0), together with Globus Network Manager.

UMD 4.1.0 is a minor update of the fourth major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for CentOS7 and SL6.
UMD 4.0.0 is the fourth Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for CentOS 7.
UMD 3.14.10 is an emergency update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, it contains an update for YAIM core for SL6.
UMD 3.14.9 is an emergency update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, it contains an update for VOMS Admin for SL6.
UMD 3.14.8 is an emergency update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, it contains an update for canL for SL6.
UMD 3.14.7 is a revision update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, it contains an update for umd-release for SL6.
UMD 3.14.6 is a revision update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, it contains an update for lcmaps-plugins-vo-ca-ap.

UMD 3.14.5 is an update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, it contains emergency updates for umd-release and gridsite for SL6. Also it includes the new VOMS release, whose client will make voms-proxy-init generate RFC proxies by default.
UMD 3.14.4 is a revision update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, it contains new packages and updates both for SL6 and SL5.
UMD 3.14.3 is a revision update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, this releases a package (umd-release) that fixes a problem with RPM signature keys.
UMD 3.14.2 is a security update of the third Major release of UMD. In particular, this release contains updates for StoRM, dCache and edg-mkgrid.

UMD 3.14.1 is a revision of the fiftheen update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for Scientific Linux 6.

UMD 3.14.0 is the fifteen update, a minor update, of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 3.13.4 is a security update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains a security fix for dCache server.

UMD 3.13.2 is a security update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains a security fix for dCache server.

UMD 3.13.2 is a revision update, of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains a dependency fix for CVMFS which was blocking its installation.

UMD 3.13.1 is a revision update, of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for Scientific Linux 5.

UMD 3.13.0 is the fourteenth update, a minor update, of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 3.12.0 is the thirteen update, a minor update, of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 3.11.1 is the twelve update, a revision update, of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 3.11.0 is the eleventh update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains  support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 3.10.0 is the tenth update of the third Major release of UMD 
(Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production 
infrastructure. This release contains support for Scientific Linux 5.

UMD 3.9.0 is the ninth update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 3.8.1 is an emergency release in order to make available to the EGI production infrastructure the classads and xerces-c packages removed from EPEL repositories. This release contains support for Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 3.8.0 is the eighth update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
emergency fix

UMD 3.7.0 is the seventh update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 3.6.0 is the sixth update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 3.5.0 is the fifth update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 3.4.0 is the fourth update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 3.3.0 is the third update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 3.2.1 is the third update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 3.2.0 is the second update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
UMD 3.1.1 is a revision of 3.1.0 made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 3.1.0 is the 1st update of the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 3.0 is the third Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 2.8.0 is the 10th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 2.7.2 is an emergency of the second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 2.7.1 is an emergency of the second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.
UMD 2.7.0 is the 9th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 2.6.0 is the 8th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 as also Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 2.5.0 is the 7th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 as also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
UMD 2.4.1 is an emergency release for UMD 2.4.1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) release made available for the EGI production infrastructure.

UMD 2.4.0 is the 6th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports Scientific Linux 5 &amp; 6 and Debian 6 (Squeeze).
UMD 2.3.1 is a revision of UMD 2.3.0 (Unified Middleware Distribution) release made available for the EGI production infrastructure.

UMD 2.3.0 is the 5th update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release introduces support for Scientific Linux 6 and Debian 6 (Squeeze).
UMD 2.2.2 is a revision of UMD 2.2.0 (Unified Middleware  Distribution) release made available for the EGI production infrastructure.
UMD 2.2.1 is a revision of &nbsp;UMD 2.2.0 (Unified Middleware Distribution) &nbsp;release &nbsp;made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release supports Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 2.2.0 is the second update of UMD-2 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release provides product updates from Technology Providers, as well as two new products.

UMD 2.1.1 is a revision of &nbsp;UMD 2.1.0 (Unified Middleware Distribution) &nbsp;release &nbsp;made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release introduces support for Scientific Linux 5 and 6.

UMD 2.1.0 is the 1st update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release introduces support for Scientific Linux 6 and Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 2.0.0 is the second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release introduces support for Scientific Linux 6 and Debian 6 (Squeeze).

UMD 1.10.1 is an emergency release for &nbsp;UMD 1.10.0 (Unified Middleware Distribution) &nbsp;release &nbsp;made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release only supports Scientific Linux 5.
UMD 1.10.0 is the fourteenth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release provides security fix from Technology Providers.
UMD 1.9.1 is the thirteenth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release provides security fix from Technology Providers.

UMD 1.9.0 is the ninth update of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release provides product updates from Technology Providers, as well as two new products.
UMD 1.8.1 is the eleventh release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release provides security fix from Technology Providers.
UMD 1.8 is the tenth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. &nbsp;This release provides security updates from Technology Providers.
UMD 1.7.1 is the ninth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware  Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release provides security updates from Technology Providers.

UMD 1.7.0 is the eighth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release provides regular maintenance updates from Technology Providers, as well as two new products.

UMD 1.6.0 is the eighth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure since its first release on 11 July 2011, and further expands on the included service available for deployment.

UMD 1.5.1 is a minor update of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure since its first release on 11 July 2011, and further expands on the included service available for deployment.

UMD 1.5.0 is the sixth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure since its first release on 11 July 2011, and further expands on the included service available for deployment.

UMD 1.4.0 is the fifth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains only the most critical products from EGI's Technology Providers as agreed by the TCB (Technology Coordination Board) on behalf of the EGI community.

UMD 1.3.0 is the fourth release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production &nbsp;infrastructure. The main features of this release are: <ul><li>Update to Globus 5.0.4 baseline provided by IGE, ensuring a continuing integration with EMI products in the EGI.<br></li><li>Updating the ARC platform to the common 1.1.0 baseline<br></li></ul>

UMD 1.2.0 is the third release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release continues the process to provide a complete set of software services for EGI's user communities to use and integrate on.

UMD 1.1.0 is the 2nd release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains only the most critical products from EGI's Technology Providers as agreed by the TCB (Technology Coordination Board) on behalf of the EGI community.

UMD 1.0.0 is the first release of UMD-1 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This initial release will contain only the most critical products from EGI's Technology Providers as agreed by the TCB (Technology Coordination Board) on behalf of the EGI community.
